turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I do, now.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: And you have horses? You love horses.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I do, beautiful horses. Thank you, Holiness.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Will you buy the sheep for me?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Where will you keep them?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Here. We'll collect them.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I will buy them for you.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Can I free the prisoners?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Hmmm.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Goodbye, Kundun.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG
turns.text: You must also do something about the public meetings. I see this, memorandum circulating, with Tibetan grievances.

turns.speaker: LUKHANGWA
turns.text: You have cracked a man's skull and that crack has not healed. It is too soon to expect him to be your friend.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG
turns.text: We are simply respecting the terms of the Seventeen Point Agreement.

turns.speaker: LUKHANGWA
turns.text: Are you, General?

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG
turns.text: We want 2,000 more tons of barley distributed.

turns.speaker: LUKHANGWA
turns.text: Impossible! You will bring famine down on the people of Tibet with these insatiable demands! More food, the best land for your soldiers to camp.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG
turns.text: The People's Liberation Army pays for all food and lodging.

turns.speaker: LUKHANGWA
turns.text: So far, they do. But, the quantity, it does not exist. You will have to re-evaluate your needs.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG
turns.text: How much tea do you drink, Prime Minister?

turns.speaker: LUKHANGWA
turns.text: It depends on the quality. And, that it be Indian.

turns.speaker: LUKHANGWA
turns.text: Why is it necessary for the Chinese to keep so many soldiers in Lhasa?

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG
turns.text: To protect. To serve you. Chairman Mao wants you to feel that China belongs to you now.

turns.speaker: LUKHANGWA
turns.text: Chairman Mao can keep China. Just give us back Tibet.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG
turns.text: Plans for absorbing the Tibetan army into the People's Army will soon be finalized.

turns.speaker: LUKHANGWA
turns.text: I will not approve it.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG
turns.text: Then, we will begin with replacing the Tibetan flag with the flag of the Motherland.

turns.speaker: LUKHANGWA
turns.text: And we will begin with tearing it down.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG CHIN-WU
turns.text: Dalai Lama.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: General Chiang.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG CHIN-WU
turns.text: We bring greetings from Chairman Mao.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Thank you. Please sit.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG CHIN-WU
turns.text: Have you heard the terms of the Seventeen Point Agreement?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I have.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG CHIN-WU
turns.text: I have a copy for you.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG CHIN-WU
turns.text: Do you have plans to return soon, Dalai Lama?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Soon.

turns.speaker: GENERAL CHIANG CHIN-WU
turns.text: Good. Our first request is that you allow us to build a road. You have no roads in Tibet. We can discuss the plans in Lhasa. When you return.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: He has been imprisoned, here in the Potala, Holiness.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: The Sera monks have surrendered?

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: It is calm.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: Very complicated, Holiness. Let me tell you current news. The Chinese have launched a deceptive campaign aimed at convincing the world that Tibet belongs to China. We sent a mission to the Chinese National Conference. Our attendance was a grave mistake.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: The Tibetans were introduced as delegates from the "Chinese region of Tibet". We protested this reference and demanded a letter rebutting it.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Did you receive the letter?

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: We did not.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: Of the Tibetan delegations sent abroad, all have been turned away.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: All?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: And the United Nations? Surely?

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: The United Nations voted not to hear our appeal.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: So, we must face China and all her might alone.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: Yes. Most of the Chamdo region is now in Chinese hands. There is a report from Chamdo which makes quite clear that, unless some settlement can soon be reached, Communist troops will soon be marching on Lhasa.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: With much bloodshed.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: I am afraid.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I want at all costs to avoid this. Do we have news from the delegation in China?

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: Not yet, but the Governor of Chamdo, Ngabo Jigme, suggests we must negotiate and offers to go to Peking.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: He is a capable man.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Time to study.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: Ngabo did not have the state seal. He could not sign.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Yes, but they say he did.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: Holiness?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: General Chiang Chin-wu, the Chinese representative, is en route to Dromo. He is coming to meet you.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Then, we shall meet.

turns.speaker: KASHAG MEMBER
turns.text: Your Prime Ministers, support the proposal that you return to Lhasa. On the opposite hand, some officials urge you not to return. They believe you should leave now, for India.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: If I were to go into exile, could we expect any serious assistance, from India, suppose?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Oh, no. Where will he go?

turns.speaker: LHAMO
turns.text: Far, far away.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Your father had been very sick.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: He had been sick from the time you began growing in me. We thought he would die.

turns.speaker: LHAMO
turns.text: Cow.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Yes. A cow had died. One night, you stopped all your moving, and I said to your sister, "His time has come."

turns.speaker: LHAMO
turns.text: Me. First break of day.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: At dawn, you were born. One eye was closed, and your sister opened it with her thumb. We gave you the sweet drink.

turns.speaker: LHAMO
turns.text: I pooped.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You did. We washed you and wrapped you in sheepskin and took you to your father. That day the father got better. And that day, a pair of crows came to nest in our roof. I just remembered.

turns.speaker: LHAMO
turns.text: I miss my brother.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I miss him too.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I will be back in a few days.

turns.speaker: LHAMO
turns.text: How many?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Two.

turns.speaker: LHAMO
turns.text: This many?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Yes, yes. Your brothers are here.

turns.speaker: LHAMO
turns.text: Who am I?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: We do not know.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: The Four Noble Truths, as taught by the Lord Sakyamuni Buddha are: The Truth of Suffering The Truth of the Cause of Suffering, The Truth of the Cessation of Suffering, the Truth of the Way which leads to the cessation of Suffering.

turns.speaker: LING RINPOCHE
turns.text: I accept it. What is suffering?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: True suffering arises from contaminated actions and afflictions. Birth, illness, grief, old age, poverty, pain, death -- these are surferings.

turns.speaker: LING RINPOCHE
turns.text: I accept it. What are the causes of suffering?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: The causes of suffering arise from true sources. Attachment, desire, envy, hatred, greed, unkindness, wrong view and so forth -- these are some causes of suffering.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I need to squeeze this brain.

turns.speaker: LING RINPOCHE
turns.text: Answer.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Can I save the sheep from going to the market? So they don't die.

turns.speaker: LOBSANG
turns.text: You could buy them.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Do I have money?

turns.speaker: LOBSANG
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Do you have money?

turns.speaker: LOBSANG
turns.text: You can't do anything real until you are Dalai Lama.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I am him.

turns.speaker: LOBSANG
turns.text: Not until you are eighteen.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: May I listen to the news with you, Holiness?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: How big is Tibet's army?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Roughly five thousand men.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Is that big?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: No. Not very big.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: The Regent is adding men. And he bought rifles and ammunition from India. Mountain guns, too.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Will we be in this war?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: No. This war is almost over.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Will we ever be in war?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: In the Pacific Ocean.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: It is an island. American territory.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Where is Alsace?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: I do not know, Holiness.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: What was the warning of the Thirteenth Dalai Lama?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: He warned about the future of Tibet.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: When it is time.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: I am sorry for you to have to witness this, Kundun.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Look here!

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: What can I do? I am only a boy.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: You are the man who wrote this letter. You are the man who has come back to lead us. You will soon have great responsibilities. You must know what to do.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I need to know what you know. I am no longer a child.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Ask whatever you will.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: What is the danger from the Chinese, now?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: The war is over. This is a time in when nations are redefining themselves.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: So, Tibet, too, needs to define itself.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Yes. As a free country. But our attempts have proven futile. We continue to be badly outmaneuvered by the Chinese.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Can India help us?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: India is a newly independent nation. They are struggling. India is in no position to help us.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Britain?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Britain chooses not to.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: And, America?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: America, we shall see.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Ask the Chinese mission to leave our country. Immediately.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Quite simple. Yes. Good.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I shall send a letter to America, to the President, informing him of our problem.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: What is the size of our army, now?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Eight thousand, five hundred, soldiers and officers. We have recently requested mortars, anti-aircraft guns and ammunition from India. We have several hundred in the area.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Has anyone died?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: The radio contact said one officer had died. Then he said, "The Chinese soldiers -- they are coming." And then, the radio went dead.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: One country did sponsor the resolution. A land called "El Salvador".

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Where is that?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: In the Americas.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Your prime minsters would argue that such negotiations should take place in Lhasa.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: And then they would concede that the times are desperate and we must go to Peking. Agreed. Send Ngabo. Is that all?

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: It is unlikely. America, perhaps. There is great anti-communist feeling in America.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: At this point, the most likely result of a foreign pact is war.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: The Chinese would see such a pact as an open declaration of war.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Tibet, at war? No. China is close, America is far away. After countless people die, China would still, always, be close. We will work with what we have.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I am scared.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Shall we consult the protective deities, Holiness?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: My first and foremost duty is to protect my people. I feel sure of this. And, things change. Maybe not right away, maybe not soon. But I believe this -- things will change.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Did you ever doubt it?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I had relinquished doubt.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I ask them to stop, to lay down their guns.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: The Khamba's gun is his most prized possession. I admire them so. They face a modern, well equipped army, and still, they fight.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Land reform is underway in Amdo. The large estates are being confiscated and redistributed. Landlords are being punished.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: A beggar can be called a landlord if he disapproves of the Chinese.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I have always asked for plain information. Just the truth.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: The Communists put their guns in the hands of the Khamba children and force the child to kill the parent. They have dropped bombs on the monastery of Lithang in Kham. It has been destroyed. Women and children, trying to escape from the fighting, have been shot with machine guns, fired from airplanes.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: The pursuit of non-violence. Very difficult.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: Non-violence means co-operation when it is possible. Resistance, when it is not.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: They will take Lhasa next.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: The people will not allow it.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: The crowd will not disperse until you give your assurance that you will not attend the Chinese festivities. Many who have been invited to dine with the Chinese do not return home.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I will not go.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: I will alert the Chinese delegation. You know, I would never have let you go alone, Kundun.

turns.speaker: LORD CHAMBERLAIN
turns.text: We are now accused of aiding the rebels. The Chinese said we can expect drastic measures to be taken to crush this revolt.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Arrange for me to speak to the people's leaders.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Good day.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Good day.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Please, come in, so cold.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: We are traveling to Lhasa. May we...?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Of course, please, this way. Your servant may use the kitchen.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MAO TSE TUNG
turns.text: You must inform me at once if any of our people abuse the Tibetans trust and good nature.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I have great hopes for the future of our co-operation.

turns.speaker: MAO TSE TUNG
turns.text: It is too early to implement all the clauses of the Seventeen Point Agreement. We will establish a Preparatory Committee for the Autonomous Region of Tibet. The pace of reform must meet with the desires of the Tibetan people. Changes must be made slowly, as you, yourself, judge necessary.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I am happy to hear you say this, Chairman Mao. I have created a reform committee to investigate grievances and we have abolished Inherited Tax, and forgiven all money owed the Government by people who are unable to pay.

turns.speaker: MAO TSE TUNG
turns.text: Good. Very good. Tibet is a great country. A wonderful history. Long ago, you even conquered part of China. But now you have fallen behind and we want to help you. In twenty years time you could be ahead of us. Then it will be your turn to help China.

turns.speaker: MAO TSE TUNG
turns.text: You know, I have great respect for your Lord Buddha. He was anti-caste. Anti-corruption. Anti-exploitation. For some, politics and religion can mix.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: For me, I think such a mix is crucial.

turns.speaker: MAO TSE TUNG
turns.text: Have a sweet. Made in my home province. The kind my mother used to make.

turns.speaker: MAO TSE TUNG
turns.text: Ah, Dalai Lama, thank you for coming so late.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I leave tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MAO TSE TUNG
turns.text: Yes, I am aware. How has your time in China been?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I have been greatly impressed by your accomplishments. Industrial progress. Great efficiency. Your people are capable and courteous.

turns.speaker: MAO TSE TUNG
turns.text: You have a lot to learn about organization. How to draw out people's opinions. How to make key decisions. Train your young Tibetans. When I make contact with you, I want to reach you through a Tibetan.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Always.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I have news. The Regent has resigned his post.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Is he a bad man? Norbu says he is "lavish" and "willful". "How can he give you monk's vows if he has not kept them himself?"

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Well, some say. It's not for you to worry about. Another will be chosen.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: He was always nice to me. He found me. He saw me in his dreams.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I turn you over again, today, Lhamo. One day, you will not be able to come running to us.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: But you will always be here?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: You will always!

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I have one more piece of news. A baby is coming.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Do you think I must?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You decide.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: This little brother was terribly sweet. When he died, my mother was so sad. A lama said to her, before the little brother was laid out for burial, take a bit of butter and rub a spot on his skin. He will come back to you, you will see. So, my mother did this, and a few years later, a new boy was born.

turns.speaker: NOBLE BOY
turns.text: Does he have the spot?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: He does, a little spot where the butter had been.

turns.speaker: NOBLE BOY
turns.text: Is that a true story, or pretend?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: NOBLE BOY
turns.text: True.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: You decide.

turns.speaker: NOBLE BOY
turns.text: What does the butter spot feel like?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Soft. Nice. I have a good friend back in Lhasa.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I'm on a big mountain and hitting at the bad men.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: And after the game, we're going to trade. You just stay over there, no, there!, Norbu, and I will shoot at you. I want your land. I take it. I am stronger.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: I am braver.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I have more men.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: I have smarter men.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: Things change, Kundun.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Why is your beard so funny? Let me touch this.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: She carried a basket in her arms, a big, heavy basket, and the old monk cautiously approached. She opened her basket and showed what she had. Heads. Human heads. Only the heads.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Is that true or pretend?

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: It is a story, you decide.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Pretend.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: As you say.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I want to go down there.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: You can only go with attendants and a big ceremony.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I want to run down the street. I want to buy a toy. Eat from the shops.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: You cannot.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I want to be a shepherd, taking those goats and cows out to the hillside.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: But you are not a shepherd, you are the Dalai Lama.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Maybe in the next life, the world will not need a Dalai Lama.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: I would not know. Maybe.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: We have enemies.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: The Chinese.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: But, surely, we are safe in Tibet. We don't believe in killing.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: This is Britain.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: Ahh.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Where is Poland?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: This is Tibet. And this is China.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: Ahh.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Why is this? What is happening? Tell me!

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: Reting Rinpoche has been arrested. He tried to overthrow Regent Taktra. Today, he is brought back to Lhasa by government officials. The monks at Sera Monastery have been on his side. Now, there is trouble between them and the army.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: The people want you made Dalai Lama.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Then, I am lucky. I am still too young.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: These are dangerous times. They want the Dalai Lama to lead them.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: But, I have no experience.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: Oh, but you do, Kundun. Who else would be here?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: You will not come?

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: No, Holiness.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Am I running away?

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: The people will cry when they learn you are gone. But they would all want you safe.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: You must study very hard, do not neglect the holy things during this time.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I will miss you.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: We have had fun, you and I. Fun for a little boy in an old palace.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: We have.

turns.speaker: NORBU THUNDRUP
turns.text: You have grown up very good.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: And you have grown older and your chin has grown balder.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: TAKSTER RINPOCHE
turns.text: They think they have convinced me. They think I am on their side. They have allowed me to leave Kumbum and come to Lhasa believing that I will try to turn you to their ways. If I do not succeed, I am to eliminate you.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: You, kill me?

turns.speaker: TAKSTER RINPOCHE
turns.text: Eliminate you.

turns.speaker: TAKSTER RINPOCHE
turns.text: Don't eat all those sweets. You'll get sick.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Do you remember the day I came to your monastery, when I was a baby? And you comforted me?

turns.speaker: TAKSTER RINPOCHE
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I remember, too, actually. I was frightened then. I am frightened now.

turns.speaker: TAKSTER RINPOCHE
turns.text: The Chinese have one goal. The complete dissolution of our nation. The destruction of our culture. There is no room for Buddha in their world. Our only hope is to fight.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: We cannot.

turns.speaker: TAKSTER RINPOCHE
turns.text: This is not a fight to put bread just in one's own mouth. This is a fight for Tibet.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Buddha teaches that we must learn from our enemy. We have compassion for all people.

turns.speaker: TAKSTER RINPOCHE
turns.text: These are not human beings. They are worse than ghosts.

turns.speaker: TAKSTER RINPOCHE
turns.text: You are in great danger. The Dalai Lama cannot fall into Chinese hands. You must flee.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: How could I ever leave?

turns.speaker: TAKSTER RINPOCHE
turns.text: It may not be your decision to make.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Taktra Rinpoche, I understand there was an attempt on your life.

turns.speaker: TAKTRA RINPOCHE
turns.text: It is possible, Holiness.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: You are unharmed?

turns.speaker: TAKTRA RINPOCHE
turns.text: Completely.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Good. Where is Reting Rinpoche now?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: If we agree that we are part of China, nothing else will matter. Not trade, not defense. We will be lost.

turns.speaker: TAKTRA RINPOCHE
turns.text: What would you do, Holiness?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: What should I do about my doubt, Teacher?

turns.speaker: TAKTRA RINPOCHE
turns.text: It is a difficult situation.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: I mean, my doubt. Why me? Am I Him?

turns.speaker: TAKTRA RINPOCHE
turns.text: Doubt is an affliction. Reliquish it. Accept.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Did you love your husband, before you married?

turns.speaker: TIBETAN WOMAN
turns.text: I did not know him before I married him. I loved his brother, but then, I married his brother, too. He is dead now.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Hmm.

turns.speaker: TIBETAN WOMAN
turns.text: The land has stayed in the family. We work together. The nobleman is not too bad.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Does he treat you fairly?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TIBETAN WOMAN
turns.text: Too young?

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Much too young.

turns.speaker: TIBETAN WOMAN
turns.text: Look for a strong woman, not too occupied with her beauty. Look for a woman who keeps her hands busy. Look for a kind heart.

turns.speaker: TENZIN GYATSO
turns.text: Like my mother.

turns.speaker: TIBETAN WOMAN
turns.text: I see that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Mrs. Bickerman, the reason we're up here... a man was fatally attacked yesterday by some animal in this lake.  Do you know how your husband died?

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: Oh yes.  I killed him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You killed him.

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: Oh, yes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He just <u>appeared</u>.  You have no idea how he arrived in this lake?

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: No.  Do you?

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: You can't take a cow by eminent domain.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We won't let him get hurt, Ma'am.

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: You're all fuckers.  Vicious little fuckers.

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: Oh, my husband passed away almost two years ago.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: My department doesn't have any record of that, Mrs. Bickerman.

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: Oh well, I'm sorry.  I didn't realize you keep such a firm track of the dead.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: And how would you have accomplished this, Ma'am?

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: Well, he was very ill and he refused to go see a doctor and well... I think he had Alzheimer's, he would be coherent one day, incoherent the next and one <u>coherent</u> day, he asked me to end his suffering.  I wouldn't <u>do</u> it but he kept insisting and insisting and deteriorating till the point the only cognitive thing he could really do was that I finish him off.  Finally I just gave in and hit him on the head with a skillet then buried him under the bulkhead.

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: I haven't broken any laws.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Oh, but you <u>have</u>, Ma'am.  You lied to us, that could be obstruction of justice.  A man's been killed in part 'cause of your silence, I could make out a charge of reckless endangerment and I'm sure PETA would be annoyed at how you treat your cows.

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: The <u>reason</u> I lied is if I'd told you the truth, you'd just hunt it down and kill it which seems to be exactly what you're doing.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Ma'am.  Your husband, Bernie.  You didn't, by any chance, lead him to the lake blindfolded?

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: <u>No</u>, <u>I</u> <u>did</u> <u>not</u>.  The crocodile <u>did</u> kill him, though. But it was all... it was a mistake.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Ma'am, how could you not report this?  He puts human life at risk and--

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: Nobody <u>lives</u> on this lake.  it's really <u>his</u> lake now.

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: Murders and rapes in the cities. People bomb planes... can the police stop them?  <u>No</u>.  But feed one little cow to a crocodile...

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: You're to wait right here until the police show, you're under full house arrest.

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: Thank you, Officer Fuckmeat.

turns.speaker: BICKERMAN
turns.text: I'll sue you.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: You're a beautiful woman.

turns.speaker: GARE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: And law enforcement, such dangerous work.  The idea that you could die suddenly with no offspring, disconcerting, let's mate, commit your genes to perpetuity.

turns.speaker: GARE
turns.text: It seems like we're getting lower.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: It happens when I land.

turns.speaker: GARE
turns.text: Why are we landing?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: 'Cause this is the cove he obviously lives in.

turns.speaker: GARE
turns.text: <u>So</u> <u>why</u> <u>are</u> <u>we</u> <u>landing</u>?  <u>Hector</u>.

turns.speaker: GARE
turns.text: C'mon Hector.  I know you're crazy but you can't--

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I need to see his habitat.

turns.speaker: GARE
turns.text: <u>Please</u>.  I'll have sex with you, anything, but get out of the water.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: He's not gonna hurt <u>me</u>.

turns.speaker: GARE
turns.text: I might get a shot.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: <u>No</u>.  If you don't kill him instantly, I'm dead and you'll only kill him instantly if you get his brain, which is about the size of a cherry.  And even if you <u>were</u> on target, a bullet might not penetrate his hide.

turns.speaker: GARE
turns.text: Jesus.  About twelve more yards.  Keep coming just like that.

turns.speaker: GARE
turns.text: Go!!!

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: <u>I'm</u> <u>trying</u>!!!
